movie_title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
introduction:

vocabulary.definition: the basic physical and organizational structures and facilities needed for the operation of a society or enterprise
vocabulary.example: The city invested in improving its infrastructure by building new roads and bridges.

vocabulary.definition: a rope, chain, or similar restraint for holding something in place, typically one forming part of a system for limiting movement
vocabulary.example: The astronaut used a tether to secure himself to the spacecraft during the spacewalk.

vocabulary.definition: the height of an object or point in relation to sea level or ground level
vocabulary.example: The plane reached an altitude of 30,000 feet before leveling off.

vocabulary.definition: the resistance that one surface or object encounters when moving over another
vocabulary.example: The skateboard's wheels were not rolling smoothly due to the friction with the ground.

vocabulary.definition: the action or fact of treating someone unfairly in order to benefit from their work
vocabulary.example: The company was accused of exploitation for paying its workers below minimum wage.

vocabulary.definition: able to be maintained at a certain rate or level without depleting natural resources or causing environmental damage
vocabulary.example: The company implemented sustainable practices to reduce its carbon footprint.
